item.description: the internet is finally ready for prime time as far the webby awards, the leading ceremony honoring the best of the net, is concerned.

item.title: port id program may compromise security: senator
item.description: a federal investigation has found serious problems with the worker identification program at u.s. ports that could compromise security, a u.s. senator from new jersey said on tuesday.

item.title: diageo to split region to focus on growth
item.description: british spirits giant diageo is to split up its international region into africa and latin america in a policy to focus more resources on fast growing emerging markets and away from some mature markets.

item.title: pakistani shi'ites killed in suspected militant attack
item.description: suspected islamist militants on friday opened fire on a group of pakistani shi'ites in the town of quetta, killing at least eight and wounding 15, police said, the first major violent incident since the death of osama bin laden.

item.title: supreme court temporarily blocks arizona execution
item.description: the supreme court has granted a stay of execution for a convicted killer in arizona who was due to die by lethal injection on tuesday, but the inmate could still be executed this week if the court rejects a petition from his lawyers.

item.title: no ban on head hits but gms hope for safer game
item.description: nhl general managers, facing an increase in concussions on the ice, backed away from banning hits to the head but expressed confidence on wednesday they could make the game safer without a rule change.

item.title: violence starting to turn canadians away from nhl
item.description: after a week of heated debate over violence in the nhl, washington capitals head coach bruce boudreau had a blunt message for the game's harshest critics: "if you don't like it, don't come to the games."

item.title: senators snap rangers streak with shootout victory

item.title: answering questions about food supply

item.title: form man djokovic out of monte carlo with knee injury
item.description: world number two novak djokovic, unbeaten this year, said on friday he was pulling out of next week's monte carlo masters due to a knee injury.

item.title: fitch cuts japan credit rating outlook to negative
item.description: ratings agency fitch on friday cut its outlook on japan's sovereign debt, warning that the vast cost of a march earthquake and tsunami and the still-unknown bill for the clean-up after the nuclear disaster would further strain the country's already shaky public finances.
